intro: Adenia nicobarica, commonly known as the Nicobar Adenia, is a climbing plant native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its fruit is a fleshy, orange-red berry that contains several seeds. Adenia nicobarica is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
